newsitem.title: USA: Northrop Grumman gets $132 mln USAF deals.
newsitem.headline: Northrop Grumman gets $132 mln USAF deals.

text.p: Northrop Grumman Corp said Monday it won two contracts worth $132 million with the U.S. Air Force for the Joint Surveillance Target Attack Radar System.
The Joint STARS computer replacement program will run for 30 months comprises a base $74 million contract and a $58 million increase for additional improvements, Northrop said.
The base contract calls for Northrop to integrate new, more powerful central computers and workstations, install new hardware and upgrade with added computers that will be much faster.

In a separate statement, the company said its Electronic Sensors and Systems Division won a contract of more than $50 million from the Boeing Co to supply a key electro-optical sensor for Britain's Royal Air Force maritime patrol aircraft.
Earlier Monday, Northrop Grumman also said it won a contract worth more than $200 million to produce nacelle components for Boeing airplanes.
